concept.meta.title: Concept | Andrea Bencini
concept.meta.description: Concept and poetics by Andrea Bencini: generative art, relationships, uncertainty, complex systems, and emergent geometries inspired by Loop Quantum Gravity.
concept.title: Concept
concept.subtitle: Relationships, uncertainty, and emergent geometries: a visual language between art and science.
concept.p1: My work begins with the study of relationships.
concept.p2: My background as a data scientist led me to analyse complex systems through graphs, networks, and probabilistic models. This way of thinking, more than a technique, has become the structure of my artistic language.
concept.p3: The work takes shape through relational configurations: not as a representation of isolated objects, but as the construction of structures in which elements exist through their interactions. The work does not proceed through predefined images, but through processes.
concept.p4: Concepts such as uncertainty, emergence, and probability are not illustrated, but enacted. Each work is the result of a temporary balance, one possible configuration within a broader system.
concept.section1.title: Loop Quantum Gravity
concept.section1.p1: The Loop Quantum Gravity series emerges from a dialogue with theoretical physics and the idea that spacetime is not a continuous structure, but arises from discrete relations. Through generative graphs, the works construct maps in which nodes represent fundamental interactions rather than autonomous entities.
concept.section2.title: Relationships
concept.section2.p1: I use contemporary conceptual structures to question how systems take shape, organise themselves, and transform.
concept.closing: Each work is a configuration in which entities gain value through their relationships within a broader system.
